recipes:
'But - no-one could have survived that!'

Now and then, Tenacious Hunters somehow survive attacks that should have killed them. But their luck always runs out in the end; and there are other ways to destroy a Hunter beside physical assault.
Send a silent Minion to resolve the problem of a Hunter
This will probably ensure the Hunter ceases to trouble us. [This is less likely to succeed than an Edge attack, and success or failure will both draw attention, but the minion will usually survive.]
Send a quiet Minion to resolve the problem of a Hunter

My Minion will watch and wait. If we're lucky, they may have an opportunity to dispose of our enemy. [This is less likely to succeed than an Edge attack, and success or failure will both draw attention, but the minion will usually survive.]
Send a cautious Minion to resolve the problem of a Hunter

My Minion will wait for the right moment, though most likely that moment will never come. [This is less likely to succeed than an Edge attack, and success or failure will both draw attention, but the minion will usually survive.]
My minion has returned, with a trophy.
My minion has returned. There was no opportunity to end the Hunter's life; and the Hunter may now be aware of danger.
Send an Unstoppable Force to murder a Hunter
Unless this Hunter has some unusual protection, they're already dead. But their demise will attract attention.
100% success rate means this should never be visible.
Send a Potent Minion to murder a Hunter
My minion is powerful. This Hunter is unlikely to survive. But the attempt will draw attention.
Send a Minion to murder a Hunter
My minion's skills are limited. This Hunter will probably survive, and the attempt will draw attention.
Send Someone Unsuitable to Murder a Hunter
My minion lacks the Edge aspect, and is woefully unsuited to attacking the hunter. There's a small chance they might succeed.
My minion has returned, with a trophy.
My minion has returned, with a prisoner!
My minion has not returned. They must have failed.
Send a Devious Minion to destroy Evidence
My scheme will most likely succeed. There is always a chance that something will go awry.
No Moth 10 here. There are currently no Moth 10 minions, but also we don't want a 100% chance because there's no downside. This could easily change later.
Send a Minion to destroy Evidence
My minion's talent for deceit is limited, and this is a difficult task. They will likely fail.
Send Someone Unsuitable to Destroy Evidence
My minion lacks the Moth aspect, and will be out of their depth. There's a small chance they might succeed.
My minion has returned. The evidence has been destroyed. I am a little safer.
My minion has not returned. They have failed, and their blundering may have attracted attention...
